title.narrative: 007 COMMUN. ADVOCACY PARTNERSHIP & Communication for Development (C4D)

description.narrative: Enhanced advocacy and Communication for Development (C4D) capacity, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced advocacy and C4D capacity

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to maintain a robust presence in public communications and used numerous opportunities and various platforms to advocate for children. UNICEF has continued to be a lead organization in C4D and will continue to provide leadership in the new Country Programm (2020-2025)e. For the new Country Programme, UNICEF has developed a multi-sectoral C4D strategy focusing on four flagship result areas and other priority areas that will benefit children of Ethiopia. UNICEF will continue to focus on building the C4D capacity at all levels to achieve more results for children in the next five years. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: of C4D strategies that meet at least 4 out of 6 UNICEF global benchmarks(44001)

actual.value: 2020:4C4D strategies are fully integrated in the country programme structures and within sectoral and cross-sectoral plans. Budget has also been allocated to C4D plans and annual work plans. C4D interventions are informed by evidence on behavioural determinan
